models.name: discussion_board_categories
models.description: Foundational organizational structure for classifying discussion topics into Economics and Politics domains. Categories provide the primary taxonomy for content organization, supporting hierarchical structures with parent-child relationships (e.g., Economics > Macroeconomics). This table enables users to browse organized discussions and administrators to manage the discussion board's organizational structure. Categories are independently managed entities that support the platform's dual focus on economic and political discourse.

foreignFields.name: parent_category_id
foreignFields.description: Parent category for hierarchical organization. Null for top-level categories (Economics, Politics), references parent for subcategories (Macroeconomics references Economics). Enables multi-level category taxonomy. {@link discussion_board_categories.id}

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Category name displayed throughout the platform (e.g., 'Economics', 'Macroeconomics', 'Politics', 'International Relations'). Must be unique across all categories. Length: 3-50 characters per business rules. Used in navigation menus, category selection, and content organization.

plainFields.name: slug
plainFields.description: URL-friendly identifier derived from category name. Used for clean, readable category URLs (e.g., '/category/macroeconomics'). Must be unique for proper routing. Lowercase alphanumeric with hyphens.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Detailed explanation of the category's purpose and scope. Helps users understand what discussion topics belong in this category. Displayed on category pages and selection interfaces. Optional but recommended for user clarity.

plainFields.name: display_order
plainFields.description: Controls the order in which categories appear in listings and navigation menus. Lower numbers appear first, enabling administrators to prioritize category display (e.g., Economics=1, Politics=2). Allows custom organization beyond alphabetical sorting.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether the category is currently visible and available for use. Inactive categories (false) are hidden from category selection but existing topics remain accessible. Allows temporary disabling without deletion. Default: true.

plainFields.name: topic_count
plainFields.description: Number of discussion topics currently assigned to this category. Updated when topics are created or deleted. Used for displaying category activity levels and helping users identify active discussion areas. Maintained via application logic or triggers. Default: 0.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the category was created. Used for audit trail and tracking category establishment history. Automatically set on record creation.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the most recent modification to category information (name, description, status, etc.). Used for audit trail and change tracking. Automatically updated on record modification.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling category recovery. When set, category is hidden from active use but preserved for audit trail and data integrity. Null for active categories. Supports 30-day recovery window per platform policy.

models.name: discussion_board_guests
models.description: Represents unauthenticated visitors to the discussion board platform. Guests can browse public content but cannot create topics, post replies, or vote. Tracked for analytics, conversion metrics, and potential newsletter signups. Guest sessions are temporary and may convert to member accounts upon registration.

plainFields.name: session_id
plainFields.description: Temporary session identifier for tracking guest browsing activity during their visit. Must be unique across all guest sessions.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Optional email address if guest subscribes to newsletter or creates account later. Used for conversion tracking and marketing outreach. Not unique - same email may be entered across different guest sessions.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address of the guest for analytics, abuse prevention, and geographic tracking. IPv4 or IPv6 format.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser user agent string for device type identification and compatibility analysis.

plainFields.name: first_visit
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the guest's first visit to the platform for conversion funnel analysis.

plainFields.name: last_visit
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the guest's most recent activity on the platform. Updated on each page view.

plainFields.name: page_views
plainFields.description: Count of pages viewed during all guest sessions for engagement metrics.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this guest record was created in the system.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this guest record was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp for guest session termination. Preserves historical analytics data while marking session as ended. Null for active guest sessions.

models.name: discussion_board_members
models.description: Represents registered, authenticated users who are the core participants of the discussion board. Members can create topics, post replies, vote on content, customize their profiles, report violations, and manage preferences. This is the primary user role after email verification. Members accumulate reputation through quality contributions and can progress to moderator status when appointed by administrators.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description: Unique username chosen during registration, immutable after account creation. 3-30 characters, alphanumeric with hyphens and underscores. Used for @mentions and profile URLs.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Email address for authentication, notifications, and account recovery. Must be verified before full platform access.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Cryptographically hashed password using bcrypt with minimum cost factor 12. Never stored in plain text.

plainFields.name: display_name
plainFields.description: User's preferred public display name, can differ from username. 1-50 characters, supports Unicode, can be changed anytime.

plainFields.name: bio
plainFields.description: User biography or about me section. Maximum 500 characters, plain text with auto-detected links.

plainFields.name: avatar_url
plainFields.description: URL to user's profile picture. Either uploaded image or default avatar generated from username.

plainFields.name: location
plainFields.description: Optional geographic location (country/city) displayed on user profile. Maximum 100 characters.

plainFields.name: website
plainFields.description: Optional personal website or blog URL displayed on user profile. Must be valid HTTP/HTTPS URL.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Whether the user has verified their email address by clicking verification link. Required for full posting privileges.

plainFields.name: email_verified_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when email verification was completed. Null if not yet verified.

plainFields.name: account_status
plainFields.description: Current operational status of the account: active (normal operation), pending_verification (email not verified), suspended (temporary restriction), banned (permanent block), or deactivated (user-initiated). Provides single source of truth for account state.

plainFields.name: profile_visibility
plainFields.description: Privacy setting for profile page: public (visible to all), members_only (authenticated users), or private (hidden from search).

plainFields.name: activity_visibility
plainFields.description: Privacy setting for activity history: public, members_only, or private. Independent from profile visibility.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the member account was created (registration date).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the member account was last updated (profile changes, settings modifications).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp. When set, account is marked for deletion but retained for 30-day recovery period. Null for active accounts.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the user's most recent successful login for activity tracking and retention analysis.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the user's most recent platform activity (any authenticated action). Used for accurate engagement tracking and identifying truly active users versus dormant accounts.

plainFields.name: timezone
plainFields.description: User's preferred timezone for displaying timestamps. Standard timezone identifier (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London').

plainFields.name: language
plainFields.description: User's preferred interface language. ISO 639-1 language code (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'de').

models.name: discussion_board_moderators
models.description: Represents trusted community members elevated to help maintain discourse standards and enforce community guidelines. Moderators can review reported content, hide or remove inappropriate posts, issue warnings, temporarily suspend users, lock discussions, and feature quality topics. Appointed by administrators based on contribution history, reputation, and demonstrated understanding of guidelines. All moderator actions are logged for accountability and administrator review.

foreignFields.name: appointed_by_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator who appointed this user as moderator. References {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description: Unique username for the moderator account. 3-30 characters, alphanumeric with hyphens and underscores.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Email address for moderator authentication and official communications about moderation duties.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Cryptographically hashed password using bcrypt with minimum cost factor 12. Never stored in plain text.

plainFields.name: display_name
plainFields.description: Moderator's preferred public display name shown on moderation actions and communications.

plainFields.name: bio
plainFields.description: Moderator biography or description. May include areas of expertise or moderation focus.

plainFields.name: avatar_url
plainFields.description: URL to moderator's profile picture with moderator badge overlay.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Whether the moderator has verified their email address. Required for moderation duties.

plainFields.name: account_status
plainFields.description: Current operational status of the moderator account: active (normal moderation duties), suspended (temporarily restricted), or deactivated (no longer serving as moderator). Provides single source of truth for moderator account state.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the moderator account was initially created in the system.

plainFields.name: appointed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this user was promoted to moderator role by an administrator. May differ from created_at if account existed before moderator appointment.

plainFields.name: moderation_notes
plainFields.description: Internal notes about this moderator's appointment, performance, or areas of responsibility. Visible only to administrators.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this moderator account is currently active and has moderation privileges. False if temporarily suspended from moderation duties.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the moderator account was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp. When set, moderator privileges are revoked but account history is retained for audit purposes.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the moderator's most recent login for activity monitoring.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the moderator's most recent platform activity including moderation actions. Used for tracking moderator engagement and identifying inactive moderators.

models.name: discussion_board_administrators
models.description: Represents platform operators with full system control and ultimate authority over all operations. Administrators can appoint and remove moderators, permanently ban users, manage categories and site-wide settings, access all audit logs, configure platform parameters, and override any moderation decisions. This role is limited to platform owners and senior staff. All administrator actions are logged for security and accountability.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description: Unique username for the administrator account. 3-30 characters, alphanumeric with hyphens and underscores.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Email address for administrator authentication and critical system notifications.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Cryptographically hashed password using bcrypt with minimum cost factor 12. Never stored in plain text.

plainFields.name: display_name
plainFields.description: Administrator's preferred public display name shown on administrative communications and actions.

plainFields.name: bio
plainFields.description: Administrator biography or description. May include role and responsibilities.

plainFields.name: avatar_url
plainFields.description: URL to administrator's profile picture with administrator badge overlay.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Whether the administrator has verified their email address. Required for administrative operations.

plainFields.name: account_status
plainFields.description: Current operational status of the administrator account: active (normal operations), suspended (temporarily restricted), or deactivated (no longer serving as administrator). Provides single source of truth for admin account state.

plainFields.name: is_super_admin
plainFields.description: Whether this administrator has super admin privileges (platform owner). Super admins can create other administrators and have unrestricted access.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the administrator account was created in the system.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the administrator account was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp. When set, administrative privileges are revoked but account is retained for complete audit trail.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the administrator's most recent login for security monitoring and activity tracking.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the administrator's most recent platform activity including administrative actions. Used for tracking administrator engagement and security monitoring.

plainFields.name: timezone
plainFields.description: Administrator's preferred timezone for displaying timestamps in admin interfaces. Standard timezone identifier.

plainFields.name: language
plainFields.description: Administrator's preferred interface language. ISO 639-1 language code.

models.name: discussion_board_sessions
models.description: Active user sessions for authenticated users. Each session represents a logged-in user on a specific device with an associated JWT access token. Sessions track device information, location, and activity for security monitoring. Users can view and revoke their own sessions across multiple devices. This is a PRIMARY stance table as users independently manage their active sessions.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the member who owns this session. {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Null if session belongs to moderator or administrator.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the moderator who owns this session. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}. Null if session belongs to member or administrator.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the administrator who owns this session. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}. Null if session belongs to member or moderator.

plainFields.name: access_token_hash
plainFields.description: Hashed JWT access token identifier for secure token validation. Never store plain tokens. Used to identify and validate active sessions.

plainFields.name: device_type
plainFields.description: Type of device used for this session. Examples: Desktop, Mobile, Tablet. Extracted from user agent string.

plainFields.name: browser_info
plainFields.description: Browser name and version information extracted from user agent. Examples: Chrome 120.0, Firefox 121.0, Safari 17.0.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which the session was created. Used for security monitoring and location approximation.

plainFields.name: location
plainFields.description: Approximate geographic location based on IP address. City-level precision. Example: New York, USA. May be null if location cannot be determined.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this session is currently active. False when session is revoked by user or invalidated by system (logout, password change, expiration).

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the access token expires. Access tokens expire after 30 minutes. Session must use refresh token to obtain new access token after expiration.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the last activity in this session. Updated on each authenticated request. Used to track session usage and identify inactive sessions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the session was created (user logged in).

plainFields.name: revoked_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the session was revoked. Null if session is still active. Sessions can be revoked by user logout, password change, or administrator action.

models.name: discussion_board_refresh_tokens
models.description: Refresh tokens for obtaining new access tokens without re-authentication. Each refresh token is associated with exactly one session and allows the client to request new access tokens when the current access token expires. Refresh tokens have longer expiration (7-30 days) than access tokens (30 minutes). This is a SUBSIDIARY stance table as tokens are managed automatically through the session lifecycle.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_session_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the session this refresh token belongs to. {@link discussion_board_sessions.id}. One-to-one relationship - each session has exactly one refresh token.

plainFields.name: refresh_token_hash
plainFields.description: Hashed refresh token for secure validation. Never store plain tokens. Used to authenticate refresh token requests and issue new access tokens.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the refresh token expires. Standard expiration is 7 days. Extended to 30 days when user selects Remember Me option during login.

plainFields.name: is_revoked
plainFields.description: Whether this refresh token has been revoked. True when session ends, user logs out, password changes, or token is compromised. Revoked tokens cannot be used to obtain new access tokens.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the refresh token was created (same as session creation).

plainFields.name: revoked_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the refresh token was revoked. Null if token is still valid. Set when session is terminated or security event occurs.

models.name: discussion_board_login_history
models.description: Comprehensive audit trail of all login attempts including successful logins and failed authentication attempts. Records device information, IP address, location, and failure reasons for security monitoring and breach detection. Used to implement account lockout after repeated failures and alert users to suspicious login activity. This is a SNAPSHOT stance table as it provides immutable historical audit data.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the member account associated with this login attempt. {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Null if login attempt was for moderator or administrator account.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the moderator account associated with this login attempt. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}. Null if login attempt was for member or administrator account.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the administrator account associated with this login attempt. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}. Null if login attempt was for member or moderator account.

plainFields.name: email_attempted
plainFields.description: Email address used in the login attempt. Stored even for failed attempts to track brute force attacks and credential stuffing attempts.

plainFields.name: is_successful
plainFields.description: Whether the login attempt was successful. True for successful authentication, false for failed attempts (wrong password, account locked, etc.).

plainFields.name: failure_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for login failure. Examples: incorrect_password, account_locked, account_suspended, email_not_verified, account_not_found. Null for successful logins.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which the login attempt was made. Critical for security monitoring and identifying suspicious patterns.

plainFields.name: device_type
plainFields.description: Type of device used for login attempt. Examples: Desktop, Mobile, Tablet. Extracted from user agent string.

plainFields.name: browser_info
plainFields.description: Browser name and version information. Examples: Chrome 120.0, Firefox 121.0. Used to identify login from new or unfamiliar devices.

plainFields.name: location
plainFields.description: Approximate geographic location based on IP address. City-level precision. Example: London, UK. May be null if location cannot be determined.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the login attempt occurred. Used for security analysis and identifying attack patterns over time.

models.name: discussion_board_password_resets
models.description: Temporary tokens for secure password reset workflow. When a user forgets their password, a unique reset token is generated and emailed to them. Tokens are single-use with 15-minute expiration for security. After successful password reset, the token is marked as used to prevent reuse. This is a SNAPSHOT stance table as password reset tokens capture historical security events in an append-only pattern.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the member requesting password reset. {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Null if password reset is for moderator or administrator account.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the moderator requesting password reset. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}. Null if password reset is for member or administrator account.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the administrator requesting password reset. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}. Null if password reset is for member or moderator account.

plainFields.name: reset_token_hash
plainFields.description: Hashed password reset token for secure validation. Never store plain tokens. Cryptographically random token (minimum 32 bytes) sent to user email and validated when they submit new password.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Email address to which the reset token was sent. Used to verify the reset request targets the correct account and prevent enumeration attacks.

plainFields.name: is_used
plainFields.description: Whether this reset token has been used to successfully reset the password. True after password reset completes. Used tokens cannot be reused even if still within expiration window.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reset token expires. Tokens are valid for 15 minutes from creation for security. Expired tokens are rejected even if unused.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the password reset was requested and token was generated. Used to enforce 15-minute expiration window.

plainFields.name: used_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reset token was successfully used to reset password. Null if token has not been used yet. Set when user completes password reset flow.

models.name: discussion_board_topics
models.description: Discussion topics created by members on economic and political subjects. Represents the primary content entities that initiate conversations. Topics are organized by category, can have various states (active, locked, archived, deleted), and support pinning for important discussions. Tracks view counts and reply counts for engagement metrics. References category for organization and member for authorship.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_category_id
foreignFields.description: Category this topic belongs to. Target category's {@link discussion_board_categories.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Author who created this topic. Target member's {@link discussion_board_members.id}.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Topic title between 10 and 200 characters. Displayed in topic listings and search results.

plainFields.name: body
plainFields.description: Topic body content between 20 and 50,000 characters. Supports Markdown formatting for rich text discussion content.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of the topic: active (open for replies), locked (no new replies allowed), archived (old inactive topic), or deleted (soft deleted topic).

plainFields.name: view_count
plainFields.description: Number of times this topic has been viewed. Incremented once per user per 24 hours to prevent artificial inflation.

plainFields.name: reply_count
plainFields.description: Total number of replies to this topic. Updated when replies are created or deleted.

plainFields.name: is_pinned
plainFields.description: Whether this topic is pinned to the top of category listings by moderators or administrators.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the topic was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the topic was last updated (edited or received new reply).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the topic was soft deleted. Null for active topics. Supports 30-day recovery window.

models.name: discussion_board_replies
models.description: Threaded replies to discussion topics and other replies. Supports hierarchical conversations up to 10 levels deep. Each reply belongs to a topic and optionally references a parent reply for threading. Tracks depth level to enforce maximum nesting constraints. Content length ranges from 1 to 10,000 characters. References topic for the parent discussion and member for authorship. Self-referential parent relationship enables threaded discussion structure.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Topic this reply belongs to. Target topic's {@link discussion_board_topics.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who authored this reply. Target member's {@link discussion_board_members.id}.

foreignFields.name: parent_reply_id
foreignFields.description: Parent reply this is responding to for threaded conversations. Null for top-level replies directly to the topic. Self-referential to {@link discussion_board_replies.id}.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Reply content between 1 and 10,000 characters. Supports Markdown formatting.

plainFields.name: depth_level
plainFields.description: Nesting depth of this reply in the thread hierarchy. 0 for top-level replies to topic, increments for each nested level. Maximum depth is 10.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reply was posted.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reply was last edited.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reply was soft deleted. Null for active replies. Supports recovery and maintains thread structure.

models.name: discussion_board_edit_history
models.description: Audit trail tracking all edits to topics and replies for transparency and accountability. Captures snapshots of content before and after each modification. Polymorphic relationship through entity_type and entity_id fields allows tracking edits for both topics and replies. Records who made each edit and when. Optional edit_reason provides context for modifications. Implements append-only pattern for audit integrity. References member for editor identification.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who performed this edit. Target member's {@link discussion_board_members.id}.

plainFields.name: entity_type
plainFields.description: Type of entity being edited: topic or reply. Used with entity_id to reference the edited content.

plainFields.name: entity_id
plainFields.description: ID of the edited entity. References either discussion_board_topics.id or discussion_board_replies.id based on entity_type.

plainFields.name: previous_content
plainFields.description: Snapshot of content before the edit. Preserves historical state for audit and potential rollback.

plainFields.name: new_content
plainFields.description: Snapshot of content after the edit. Shows what changed in this modification.

plainFields.name: edit_reason
plainFields.description: Optional explanation for why the edit was made. Provides context for content modifications.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this edit occurred. Represents the moment the content was modified.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp if this edit history record is soft deleted. Normally null as edit history is preserved.

models.name: discussion_board_votes
models.description: Tracks upvotes and downvotes on discussion content (topics and replies). Each vote records which user voted, what they voted on, and the vote direction. Users can only cast one vote per content item, and can change their vote within allowed time windows. Vote data drives content ranking algorithms and user reputation calculations. Supports polymorphic voting pattern to handle both topics and replies efficiently.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who cast this vote. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: votable_type
plainFields.description: Type of content being voted on. Either 'topic' or 'reply' to support polymorphic voting on different content types.

plainFields.name: votable_id
plainFields.description: ID of the content being voted on (references either discussion_board_topics.id or discussion_board_replies.id depending on votable_type).

plainFields.name: vote_type
plainFields.description: Direction of the vote. Either 'upvote' (positive, agrees/supports content) or 'downvote' (negative, disagrees/low quality content).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the vote was cast. Used for vote change time window validation and activity tracking.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the vote was last modified (vote direction changed). Used for audit trail and tracking vote changes.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling vote recovery if content is restored. Null for active votes. Supports 30-day recovery window per platform policy.

models.name: discussion_board_favorites
models.description: Tracks user bookmarks/favorites on discussion topics. Allows users to save topics for later reference and quick access. Favorited topics appear in user's personal collection and may trigger notifications for new activity based on user preferences. Supports soft deletion for recovery of accidentally removed bookmarks.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who favorited the topic. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Topic that was favorited. {@link discussion_board_topics.id}

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the topic was favorited. Used for sorting user's favorites by recency.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the favorite record was last modified. Used for audit trail.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling bookmark recovery. Null for active favorites. Supports accidental removal recovery.

models.name: discussion_board_tags
models.description: Master tag vocabulary for categorizing and organizing discussion topics. Tags provide additional categorization beyond primary categories, enabling cross-category topic discovery. Users can search, filter, and follow tags. Tags are created through topic creation workflow and managed by moderators. Tag lifecycle includes active, pending review, disabled, and merged states.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Tag name, normalized to lowercase for consistency. Must be unique across all tags. Length 2-30 characters, alphanumeric with spaces and hyphens allowed.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Optional description explaining what this tag represents and when to use it. Helps users apply tags consistently.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Tag lifecycle status: active (available for use), pending_review (awaiting moderator approval), disabled (hidden from selection), merged (consolidated into another tag).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the tag was first created. Used for tracking tag evolution and identifying emerging tags.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the tag was last modified (name, description, or status change). Used for audit trail.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling tag recovery. Null for active tags. Supports 30-day recovery window per platform policy.

models.name: discussion_board_topic_tags
models.description: Junction table establishing many-to-many relationship between topics and tags. Allows topics to be tagged with multiple relevant tags (up to 5 per topic per business rules), and tags to be applied to many topics. Supports topic discovery through tag-based filtering and search.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Topic being tagged. {@link discussion_board_topics.id}

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_tag_id
foreignFields.description: Tag applied to the topic. {@link discussion_board_tags.id}

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the tag was applied to the topic. Used for tracking tag application history.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the topic-tag association was last modified. Used for audit trail.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling tag association recovery. Null for active associations. Supports recovery if tags removed accidentally.

models.name: discussion_board_followed_tags
models.description: Tracks which tags users follow for personalized content recommendations and notifications. When users follow tags, they receive notifications about new topics with those tags and see followed tags prioritized in their feed. Supports user interest management and content personalization. Maximum 50 followed tags per user per business rules.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member following the tag. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_tag_id
foreignFields.description: Tag being followed by the member. {@link discussion_board_tags.id}

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the user started following this tag. Used for tracking user interest evolution and follow recency.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the follow relationship was last modified. Used for audit trail.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling follow relationship recovery. Null for active follows. Supports unfollow recovery.

models.name: discussion_board_watched_topics
models.description: Tracks topics users are watching for notifications on new activity (new replies, votes, etc.). Users can explicitly watch topics they're interested in to receive updates. Includes last_read_at timestamp to detect new activity since last view and show 'unread' indicators. Supports notification batching to prevent overwhelming users with excessive alerts.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member watching the topic. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Topic being watched. {@link discussion_board_topics.id}

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the user started watching this topic. Used for tracking watch duration.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the watch relationship was last modified (last_read_at updated). Used for audit trail.

plainFields.name: last_read_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the user last viewed this topic. Used to determine if there is new activity (replies, votes) since their last visit to show unread indicators and notification triggers.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling watch relationship recovery. Null for active watches. Supports unwatch recovery.

models.name: discussion_board_blocked_users
models.description: Tracks user blocking relationships for content filtering. When user A blocks user B, A no longer sees B's topics, replies, or receives notifications from B. Blocking is asymmetric (A blocking B does not mean B blocks A). Includes optional reason for accountability and support purposes. Maximum 100 blocked users per account per business rules.

foreignFields.name: blocker_id
foreignFields.description: Member who initiated the block. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: blocked_id
foreignFields.description: Member who is being blocked. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Optional user-provided reason for blocking this user. Helps support team if blocking is reported as abuse, and helps user remember why they blocked someone.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the block was created. Used for tracking block duration and history.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the block relationship was last modified. Used for audit trail.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp enabling block relationship recovery (unblock recovery). Null for active blocks. Supports accidental unblock recovery.

models.name: discussion_board_user_reputation
models.description: Aggregated reputation score for each user based on community voting on their content. Reputation represents contribution quality and community trust. Calculated from upvotes/downvotes received on topics and replies. Denormalized for performance to enable reputation-based features (leaderboards, privilege unlocking) without expensive vote aggregation queries. Updated when votes are cast, changed, or removed.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member whose reputation is tracked. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: total_score
plainFields.description: Total reputation score calculated from all votes on user's content. Weighted formula: (topic upvotes  5) - (topic downvotes  2) + (reply upvotes  2) - (reply downvotes  1). Used for leaderboards and privilege unlocking.

plainFields.name: upvotes_received
plainFields.description: Total number of upvotes received across all user's topics and replies. Used for reputation calculation and user statistics display.

plainFields.name: downvotes_received
plainFields.description: Total number of downvotes received across all user's topics and replies. Used for reputation calculation and quality monitoring.

plainFields.name: topics_score
plainFields.description: Reputation score derived from votes on user's topics only. Allows separate tracking of topic quality vs reply quality.

plainFields.name: replies_score
plainFields.description: Reputation score derived from votes on user's replies only. Allows separate tracking of reply quality vs topic quality.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reputation was last recalculated. Used for cache invalidation and tracking reputation changes over time.

models.name: mv_discussion_board_user_reputation
models.description: Materialized view aggregating reputation scores for each user based on community voting on their content. Reputation represents contribution quality and community trust. Calculated from votes received on topics and replies using weighted formula: (topic upvotes  5) - (topic downvotes  2) + (reply upvotes  2) - (reply downvotes  1). This denormalized view enables reputation-based features (leaderboards, privilege unlocking, reputation badges) without expensive real-time vote aggregation queries. Refreshed periodically or on vote events.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member whose reputation is tracked. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: total_score
plainFields.description: Total reputation score calculated from all votes on user's content. Weighted formula: (topic upvotes  5) - (topic downvotes  2) + (reply upvotes  2) - (reply downvotes  1). Used for leaderboards and privilege unlocking.

plainFields.name: upvotes_received
plainFields.description: Total number of upvotes received across all user's topics and replies. Used for reputation calculation and user statistics display.

plainFields.name: downvotes_received
plainFields.description: Total number of downvotes received across all user's topics and replies. Used for reputation calculation and quality monitoring.

plainFields.name: topics_score
plainFields.description: Reputation score derived from votes on user's topics only. Allows separate tracking of topic quality vs reply quality.

plainFields.name: replies_score
plainFields.description: Reputation score derived from votes on user's replies only. Allows separate tracking of reply quality vs topic quality.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reputation was last recalculated. Used for cache invalidation and tracking reputation changes over time.

models.name: mv_discussion_board_tag_statistics
models.description: Materialized view providing aggregated statistics for tags including usage counts, trending metrics, and activity indicators. Denormalizes data from topic_tags junction table for efficient tag cloud generation, popular tags display, and tag discovery features. Refreshed periodically to reflect current tag usage patterns without impacting normalized base tables.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_tag_id
foreignFields.description: Tag for which statistics are calculated. {@link discussion_board_tags.id}

plainFields.name: usage_count
plainFields.description: Number of topics currently tagged with this tag. Aggregated from topic_tags junction table. Used for popular tags display and tag cloud generation.

plainFields.name: recent_usage_count
plainFields.description: Number of topics tagged in the last 7 days. Used for identifying trending tags and emerging topics.

plainFields.name: total_votes
plainFields.description: Sum of all votes (upvotes + downvotes) on topics with this tag. Indicates tag engagement level.

plainFields.name: follower_count
plainFields.description: Number of users following this tag. Aggregated from followed_tags junction table. Indicates tag popularity.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when these statistics were last recalculated. Used for cache invalidation and refresh scheduling.

models.name: discussion_board_reports
models.description: Content reports submitted by members flagging topics or replies that violate community guidelines. Each report captures the violation category, reporter's explanation, and resolution status. Reports feed into the moderation queue for review by moderators and administrators.

foreignFields.name: reporter_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who submitted the report. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: reported_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Reported topic if violation is in a topic. {@link discussion_board_topics.id}

foreignFields.name: reported_reply_id
foreignFields.description: Reported reply if violation is in a reply. {@link discussion_board_replies.id}

foreignFields.name: assigned_moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator assigned to review this report. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}

plainFields.name: violation_category
plainFields.description: Category of violation reported: personal_attack, hate_speech, misinformation, spam, offensive_language, off_topic, threats, doxxing, trolling, or other.

plainFields.name: severity_level
plainFields.description: Severity level of the violation: critical, high, medium, or low. Used for prioritization in moderation queue.

plainFields.name: reporter_explanation
plainFields.description: Optional additional context provided by the reporter explaining why this content violates guidelines. Maximum 500 characters.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of the report: pending, under_review, resolved, or dismissed.

plainFields.name: resolution_notes
plainFields.description: Moderator's notes explaining the resolution decision. Required when status changes to resolved or dismissed.

plainFields.name: dismissal_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for dismissal if report was dismissed: no_violation, within_guidelines, malicious_report, insufficient_evidence, or other.

plainFields.name: resolved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the report was resolved or dismissed by a moderator.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the report was submitted.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the report was last updated.

models.name: discussion_board_moderation_actions
models.description: Comprehensive log of all moderation actions taken by moderators and administrators. Each action records what was done, to whom, by whom, and why. This table serves as the central audit trail for all content governance activities on the platform.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator who performed the action. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}

foreignFields.name: administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator who performed the action. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}

foreignFields.name: target_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who is the target of this moderation action. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: related_report_id
foreignFields.description: Report that triggered this moderation action, if applicable. {@link discussion_board_reports.id}

foreignFields.name: content_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Topic that was subject to moderation action. {@link discussion_board_topics.id}

foreignFields.name: content_reply_id
foreignFields.description: Reply that was subject to moderation action. {@link discussion_board_replies.id}

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of moderation action: hide_content, delete_content, issue_warning, suspend_user, ban_user, restore_content, or dismiss_report.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Detailed explanation of why this moderation action was taken. Minimum 20 characters required for accountability.

plainFields.name: violation_category
plainFields.description: Category of guideline violation that prompted this action. Same categories as reports.

plainFields.name: content_snapshot
plainFields.description: Preserved snapshot of the content exactly as it appeared when the action was taken. Maintained even if user edits or deletes later.

plainFields.name: is_reversed
plainFields.description: Whether this moderation action was reversed on appeal or administrative review.

plainFields.name: reversed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the action was reversed, if applicable.

plainFields.name: reversal_reason
plainFields.description: Explanation for why the action was reversed.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the moderation action was taken.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the moderation action record was last updated.

models.name: discussion_board_warnings
models.description: Formal warnings issued to members for guideline violations. Implements a three-tier escalation system (first, second, final) with automatic expiration. Warnings escalate to suspensions and potential bans if violations continue within the warning period.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who received the warning. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Moderation action that issued this warning. {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}

foreignFields.name: content_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Topic that triggered the warning. {@link discussion_board_topics.id}

foreignFields.name: content_reply_id
foreignFields.description: Reply that triggered the warning. {@link discussion_board_replies.id}

plainFields.name: warning_level
plainFields.description: Level of warning in escalation system: first_warning, second_warning, or final_warning.

plainFields.name: violation_category
plainFields.description: Category of guideline violation that prompted the warning.

plainFields.name: moderator_notes
plainFields.description: Internal notes from the moderator explaining the warning decision and context.

plainFields.name: expiration_date
plainFields.description: Date when this warning expires. First warnings expire after 90 days, second after 180 days, final warnings may not expire.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this warning is currently active and counts toward escalation. False if expired or user account in good standing.

plainFields.name: expired_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the warning expired naturally without further violations.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the warning was issued.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the warning record was last updated.

models.name: discussion_board_suspensions
models.description: Temporary account suspensions that restrict member posting privileges for a specified duration. Suspensions prevent content creation and voting while allowing read access. Automatically expire and restore full privileges when the suspension period ends.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who is suspended. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Moderation action that initiated this suspension. {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator who issued the suspension. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}

foreignFields.name: administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator who issued the suspension if it was an admin action. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}

plainFields.name: suspension_reason
plainFields.description: Detailed explanation of why the member was suspended. Shown to the suspended user.

plainFields.name: duration_days
plainFields.description: Length of suspension in days. Common durations: 1, 7, 14, or 30 days based on violation severity.

plainFields.name: start_date
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the suspension begins and restrictions take effect.

plainFields.name: end_date
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the suspension expires and full privileges are automatically restored.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this suspension is currently in effect. False if expired or manually lifted.

plainFields.name: lifted_early
plainFields.description: Whether the suspension was manually lifted before the scheduled end date.

plainFields.name: lifted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the suspension was manually lifted by a moderator or administrator.

plainFields.name: lifted_reason
plainFields.description: Explanation for why the suspension was lifted early.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the suspension was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the suspension record was last updated.

models.name: discussion_board_bans
models.description: Permanent account bans that completely prevent platform access. Issued only by administrators for severe or repeated violations. Bans may be appealable or non-appealable based on violation severity. All user content is hidden but preserved for audit purposes.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Member who is permanently banned. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator who issued the permanent ban. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Moderation action that initiated this ban. {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}

plainFields.name: ban_reason
plainFields.description: Comprehensive justification for the permanent ban. Minimum 100 characters required due to severity of action.

plainFields.name: violation_summary
plainFields.description: Summary of all violations that led to the ban decision. Provides historical context.

plainFields.name: is_appealable
plainFields.description: Whether the banned user is permitted to submit an appeal. False for severe violations like illegal content or threats.

plainFields.name: appeal_window_days
plainFields.description: Number of days the user has to submit an appeal if ban is appealable. Typically 30 days.

plainFields.name: ip_address_banned
plainFields.description: IP address at time of ban to help prevent re-registration attempts.

plainFields.name: email_banned
plainFields.description: Email address banned from future registration to prevent account recreation.

plainFields.name: is_reversed
plainFields.description: Whether the ban was reversed after successful appeal or administrative review.

plainFields.name: reversed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the ban was reversed and account access restored.

plainFields.name: reversal_reason
plainFields.description: Explanation for why the ban was reversed.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the ban was issued.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the ban record was last updated.

models.name: discussion_board_appeals
models.description: Appeals submitted by users contesting moderation decisions including warnings, suspensions, bans, and content removals. Each appeal provides user explanation and goes through administrator review. Appeals can be approved (reversing the decision), denied (upholding the decision), or result in modified penalties.

foreignFields.name: member_id
foreignFields.description: Member submitting the appeal. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: appealed_moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Moderation action being appealed. {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}

foreignFields.name: appealed_warning_id
foreignFields.description: Warning being appealed. {@link discussion_board_warnings.id}

foreignFields.name: appealed_suspension_id
foreignFields.description: Suspension being appealed. {@link discussion_board_suspensions.id}

foreignFields.name: appealed_ban_id
foreignFields.description: Ban being appealed. {@link discussion_board_bans.id}

foreignFields.name: reviewing_administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator assigned to review this appeal. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}

plainFields.name: appeal_explanation
plainFields.description: User's written explanation of why the moderation decision should be reversed. Between 100 and 1000 characters required.

plainFields.name: additional_evidence
plainFields.description: Optional additional context or evidence the user provides to support their appeal.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of the appeal: pending_review, under_review, approved, denied, or modified.

plainFields.name: decision
plainFields.description: Administrator's decision on the appeal: uphold_original (deny), reverse_decision (approve), or modify_penalty.

plainFields.name: decision_reasoning
plainFields.description: Detailed explanation from administrator about why the appeal was approved, denied, or modified. Minimum 50 characters.

plainFields.name: corrective_action_taken
plainFields.description: Description of any corrective actions taken if appeal was approved (content restored, warning removed, suspension lifted, etc.).

plainFields.name: submitted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the user submitted the appeal.

plainFields.name: reviewed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the administrator completed their review and made a decision.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the appeal record was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the appeal record was last updated.

models.name: discussion_board_notifications
models.description: Stores individual notification records delivered to users for various platform events including replies, mentions, votes, moderation actions, and system announcements. Each notification represents a discrete event that users can view, mark as read, and interact with through the notification center. Notifications support both in-app and email delivery channels with separate tracking for each. Uses explicit foreign keys instead of polymorphic pattern to ensure referential integrity with discussion topics, replies, moderation actions, and triggering users (members, moderators, administrators).

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Recipient user who receives this notification. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: triggering_member_id
foreignFields.description: Member whose action triggered this notification (e.g., posted reply, cast vote). Null for moderator/admin actions or system notifications. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

foreignFields.name: triggering_moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator whose action triggered this notification (e.g., moderation action). Null for member/admin actions. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}

foreignFields.name: triggering_administrator_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator whose action triggered this notification (e.g., system announcement, admin moderation). Null for member/moderator actions. {@link discussion_board_administrators.id}

foreignFields.name: related_topic_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion topic related to this notification (for reply_to_topic, topic-related events). Null if notification not topic-related. {@link discussion_board_topics.id}

foreignFields.name: related_reply_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion reply related to this notification (for reply_to_comment, reply-related events). Null if notification not reply-related. {@link discussion_board_replies.id}

foreignFields.name: related_moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Moderation action related to this notification (for moderation_action type notifications). Null for non-moderation notifications. {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}

plainFields.name: notification_type
plainFields.description: Type of notification: reply_to_topic, reply_to_comment, mention, vote_milestone, moderation_action, system_announcement, watched_topic_update, welcome

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Notification headline displayed to user (e.g., 'New reply to your topic', 'You were mentioned')

plainFields.name: message
plainFields.description: Notification content preview or detailed message (first 200 characters of reply, moderation reason, etc.)

plainFields.name: link_url
plainFields.description: Deep link URL to the relevant content (topic, reply, profile, etc.). Null for notifications without specific target content.

plainFields.name: is_read
plainFields.description: Whether user has marked this notification as read (clicked or explicitly marked read)

plainFields.name: is_seen
plainFields.description: Whether user has seen this notification in the notification center (viewed but not necessarily read)

plainFields.name: delivered_in_app
plainFields.description: Whether this notification was delivered through in-app notification center

plainFields.name: delivered_via_email
plainFields.description: Whether this notification was delivered via email to user's registered address

plainFields.name: email_sent_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when email notification was successfully sent. Null if email not sent or delivery failed.

plainFields.name: email_delivery_status
plainFields.description: Email delivery status: queued, sent, failed, bounced. Null if email delivery not attempted.

plainFields.name: email_failure_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for email delivery failure if status is failed or bounced. Null for successful deliveries.

plainFields.name: email_retry_count
plainFields.description: Number of email delivery retry attempts. Incremented on each retry, maximum 3 retries per requirements.

plainFields.name: read_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when user marked notification as read. Null if unread.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when notification was created and queued for delivery

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when notification record was last updated (status changes, read status, etc.)

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp for user-deleted notifications. Supports 90-day retention window before permanent cleanup. Null for active notifications.

models.name: discussion_board_notification_preferences
models.description: Stores user notification preferences controlling which events trigger notifications and through which channels (in-app, email). Supports granular per-event-type configuration, digest modes (hourly, daily, weekly), and quiet hours settings. Each user has exactly one preference record with default values applied at registration.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who owns these notification preferences. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: reply_to_topic_in_app
plainFields.description: Enable in-app notifications when someone replies to user's topic

plainFields.name: reply_to_topic_email
plainFields.description: Enable email notifications when someone replies to user's topic

plainFields.name: reply_to_comment_in_app
plainFields.description: Enable in-app notifications when someone replies to user's comment

plainFields.name: reply_to_comment_email
plainFields.description: Enable email notifications when someone replies to user's comment

plainFields.name: mention_in_app
plainFields.description: Enable in-app notifications when user is mentioned with @username

plainFields.name: mention_email
plainFields.description: Enable email notifications when user is mentioned with @username

plainFields.name: vote_milestone_in_app
plainFields.description: Enable in-app notifications when user's content reaches vote milestones (10, 25, 50, 100, etc.)

plainFields.name: vote_milestone_email
plainFields.description: Enable email notifications when user's content reaches vote milestones

plainFields.name: moderation_action_in_app
plainFields.description: Enable in-app notifications for moderation actions affecting user (warnings, suspensions, content removal)

plainFields.name: moderation_action_email
plainFields.description: Enable email notifications for moderation actions affecting user

plainFields.name: watched_topic_in_app
plainFields.description: Enable in-app notifications for updates to topics user is watching

plainFields.name: watched_topic_email
plainFields.description: Enable email notifications for updates to topics user is watching

plainFields.name: system_announcement_in_app
plainFields.description: Enable in-app notifications for system-wide announcements from administrators

plainFields.name: system_announcement_email
plainFields.description: Enable email notifications for system-wide announcements

plainFields.name: digest_frequency
plainFields.description: Email notification batching frequency: realtime (immediate), hourly, daily, weekly

plainFields.name: quiet_hours_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether quiet hours are active (suppress email notifications during specified hours)

plainFields.name: quiet_hours_start
plainFields.description: Quiet hours start time in HH:mm format (24-hour). Null if quiet hours disabled.

plainFields.name: quiet_hours_end
plainFields.description: Quiet hours end time in HH:mm format (24-hour). Null if quiet hours disabled.

plainFields.name: timezone
plainFields.description: User's timezone for digest scheduling and quiet hours calculation (IANA timezone identifier)

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when preference record was created (typically at user registration)

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when preferences were last modified by user

models.name: discussion_board_notification_batches
models.description: Tracks batched and digest notifications to optimize delivery and prevent duplicate notifications. System creates batch records for hourly/daily/weekly digests and for similar notifications occurring within batching windows. Batch records track which individual notifications are included, delivery status, and scheduling information. Uses JSONB for efficient storage and querying of notification ID arrays.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User receiving this batched notification delivery. {@link discussion_board_members.id}

plainFields.name: batch_type
plainFields.description: Type of batch: hourly_digest, daily_digest, weekly_digest, batched_replies, batched_mentions, batched_watched_topic

plainFields.name: notification_ids
plainFields.description: JSONB array of notification UUIDs included in this batch. Stored as JSONB for efficient querying and indexing. Example: ["uuid1", "uuid2", "uuid3"]

plainFields.name: notification_count
plainFields.description: Total number of individual notifications combined in this batch

plainFields.name: sent_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when batch notification was successfully delivered. Null if pending or failed.

plainFields.name: scheduled_for
plainFields.description: Timestamp when batch is scheduled for delivery (considering user preferences, quiet hours, digest frequency)

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Batch delivery status: pending (not yet sent), sent (successfully delivered), failed (delivery failed after retries)

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when batch record was created

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when batch record was last updated (status changes, delivery attempts)

models.name: discussion_board_audit_logs
models.description: General audit trail for all significant user and system actions across the platform. Records create, update, delete operations on topics, replies, votes, and user profile changes. Provides comprehensive activity tracking for compliance, security analysis, and user activity monitoring. Immutable records ensure audit integrity.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who performed the action. {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Nullable for system-initiated events.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of action performed (e.g., topic_created, reply_posted, vote_cast, profile_updated, content_deleted).

plainFields.name: entity_type
plainFields.description: Type of entity affected by the action (e.g., topic, reply, vote, user, tag).

plainFields.name: entity_id
plainFields.description: UUID of the affected entity. Nullable if action does not target a specific entity.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description of the action for audit review and reporting.

plainFields.name: metadata
plainFields.description: JSON blob containing additional context about the action (before/after values, affected fields, request parameters).

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which the action was performed. Nullable for system-initiated actions.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser user agent string for device and browser tracking. Nullable for API or system actions.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the audit log entry was created. Immutable audit records have no updated_at.

models.name: discussion_board_security_logs
models.description: Security-specific event logging for authentication attempts, permission denials, account lockouts, and suspicious activities. Tracks login successes and failures, account security events, rate limit violations, and potential security threats. Critical for security monitoring, incident response, and compliance with security audit requirements.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User associated with the security event. {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Nullable for failed login attempts with invalid credentials.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Type of security event (e.g., login_success, login_failed, account_locked, permission_denied, suspicious_activity, rate_limit_exceeded).

plainFields.name: severity
plainFields.description: Severity level of the security event: low, medium, high, or critical. Used for prioritizing security response.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which the security event originated. Required for security analysis and IP-based blocking.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser user agent string for device fingerprinting and bot detection. Nullable for some automated events.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description of the security event for incident review and reporting.

plainFields.name: metadata
plainFields.description: JSON blob containing detailed security event context (failed login reason, permission attempted, threat indicators).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the security event occurred. Used for security timeline analysis and incident investigation.

models.name: discussion_board_moderation_audit_logs
models.description: Comprehensive audit trail of all moderation actions for accountability, transparency, and appeals processing. Logs content removal, user warnings, suspensions, bans, and moderator interventions. Includes moderator identity, target user/content, action rationale, and preserved content snapshots. Essential for moderator performance review and user appeal investigations.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator who performed the action. {@link discussion_board_moderators.id}. Nullable for automated moderation actions.

foreignFields.name: target_user_id
foreignFields.description: User targeted by the moderation action. {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Nullable for content-only actions.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of moderation action (e.g., content_hidden, content_removed, warning_issued, user_suspended, user_banned, appeal_approved).

plainFields.name: target_content_id
plainFields.description: UUID of the content affected by moderation. Nullable for user-level actions without specific content.

plainFields.name: target_content_type
plainFields.description: Type of content affected (topic or reply). Nullable for user-level actions.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Moderator's explanation for the action. Required for transparency and appeals process.

plainFields.name: metadata
plainFields.description: JSON blob containing additional context (original content snapshot, violation category, previous warnings, action duration for suspensions).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the moderation action was performed. Immutable for audit integrity.

models.name: discussion_board_search_history
models.description: Tracks user search queries for search analytics, query improvement, and personalized recommendations. Records search terms, applied filters, result counts, and user engagement with results. Used for identifying common search patterns, improving search algorithms, and understanding user information needs. Supports both authenticated users and guest searches.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who performed the search. {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Nullable for guest searches.

plainFields.name: search_query
plainFields.description: The actual search text entered by the user. Used for search analytics and query pattern identification.

plainFields.name: filters_applied
plainFields.description: JSON blob containing search filters (category, date range, vote threshold, tag filters). Nullable if no filters used.

plainFields.name: results_count
plainFields.description: Number of search results returned. Used to identify zero-result queries and search effectiveness.

plainFields.name: clicked_result_id
plainFields.description: UUID of the search result the user clicked on. Nullable if user did not click any result. Used for relevance tracking.

plainFields.name: session_id
plainFields.description: Session identifier to track related searches within a session. Nullable for one-off searches.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the search was performed. Used for search trend analysis over time.
